summary.para: Converts base data types to an array of bytes, and an array of bytes to base data types.

content.para: This class facilitates manipulating value types in their fundamental form. A byte is defined as an 8-bit unsigned integer.
The following code example illustrates the use of several BitConverter class methods.

summary.para: Indicates the byte order ("endianess") in which data is stored in this computer architecture.

content.para: This value is true if the architecture is little-endian; false if it is big-endian.

Different computer architectures store data using different byte orders. "Big-endian" means the most significant byte is on the left end of a word. "Little-endian" means the most significant byte is on the right end of a word.
The following code example illustrates the use of the IsLittleEndian field.

summary.para: Converts the specified double-precision floating point number to a 64-bit signed integer.

returnValue.para: A 64-bit signed integer whose value is equivalent to value.

content.para: The following code example converts the bit patterns of several T:System.Double values to T:System.Int64 values with the DoubleToInt64Bits method.

summary.para: Converts the specified data to an array of bytes.
Returns the specified Boolean value as an array of bytes.

returnValue.para: An array of bytes with length 1.

content.para: The following code example converts the bit patterns of T:System.Boolean values to T:System.Byte arrays with the GetBytes method.

summary.para: Converts the specified data to an array of bytes.
Returns the specified Unicode character value as an array of bytes.

returnValue.para: An array of bytes with length 2.

content.para: The following code example converts the bit patterns of T:System.Char values (Unicode characters) to T:System.Byte arrays with the GetBytes method.

summary.para: Returns the specified double-precision floating point value as an array of bytes.

returnValue.para: An array of bytes with length 8.

content.para: The following code example converts the bit patterns of T:System.Double values to T:System.Byte arrays with the GetBytes method.

summary.para: Returns the specified 16-bit signed integer value as an array of bytes.

returnValue.para: An array of bytes with length 2.

content.para: The following code example converts the bit patterns of T:System.Int16 values to T:System.Byte arrays with the GetBytes method.

summary.para: Returns the specified 32-bit signed integer value as an array of bytes.

returnValue.para: An array of bytes with length 4.

content.para: The following code example converts the bit patterns of T:System.Int32 values to T:System.Byte arrays with the GetBytes method.

summary.para: Returns the specified 64-bit signed integer value as an array of bytes.

returnValue.para: An array of bytes with length 8.

content.para: The following code example converts the bit patterns of T:System.Int64 values to T:System.Byte arrays with the GetBytes method.

summary.para: Returns the specified single-precision floating point value as an array of bytes.

returnValue.para: An array of bytes with length 4.

content.para: The following code example converts the bit patterns of T:System.Single values to T:System.Byte arrays with the GetBytes method.

summary.para: Returns the specified 16-bit unsigned integer value as an array of bytes.

returnValue.para: An array of bytes with length 2.

content.para: The following code example converts the bit patterns of T:System.UInt16 values to T:System.Byte arrays with the GetBytes method.

summary.para: Returns the specified 32-bit unsigned integer value as an array of bytes.

returnValue.para: An array of bytes with length 4.

content.para: The following code example converts the bit patterns of T:System.UInt32 values to T:System.Byte arrays with the GetBytes method.

summary.para: Returns the specified 64-bit unsigned integer value as an array of bytes.

returnValue.para: An array of bytes with length 8.

content.para: The following code example converts the bit patterns of T:System.UInt64 values to T:System.Byte arrays with the GetBytes method.

summary.para: Converts the specified 64-bit signed integer to a double-precision floating point number.

returnValue.para: A double-precision floating point number whose value is equivalent to value.

content.para: The following code example converts the bit patterns of several T:System.Int64 values to T:System.Double values with the Int64BitsToDouble method.

summary.para: Returns a Boolean value converted from one byte at a specified position in a byte array.

returnValue.para: true if the byte at startIndex in value is nonzero; otherwise, false.

content.para: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 1.
The following code example converts elements of T:System.Byte arrays to T:System.Boolean values with the ToBoolean method.

summary.para: Returns a Unicode character converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.

returnValue.para: A character formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.

content.para: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 2.
The following code example converts elements of T:System.Byte arrays to T:System.Char values (Unicode characters) with the ToChar method.

summary.para: Returns a double-precision floating point number converted from eight bytes at a specified position in a byte array.

returnValue.para: A double precision floating point number formed by eight bytes beginning at startIndex.

content.para: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 8.
The following code example converts elements of T:System.Byte arrays to T:System.Double values with the ToDouble method.

summary.para: Returns a 16-bit signed integer converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.

returnValue.para: A 16-bit signed integer formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.

content.para: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 2.
The following code example converts elements of T:System.Byte arrays to T:System.Int16 values with the ToInt16 method.

summary.para: Returns a 32-bit signed integer converted from four bytes at a specified position in a byte array.

returnValue.para: A 32-bit signed integer formed by four bytes beginning at startIndex.

content.para: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 4.
The following code example converts elements of T:System.Byte arrays to T:System.Int32 values with the ToInt32 method.

summary.para: Returns a 64-bit signed integer converted from eight bytes at a specified position in a byte array.

returnValue.para: A 64-bit signed integer formed by eight bytes beginning at startIndex.

content.para: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 8.
The following code example converts elements of T:System.Byte arrays to T:System.Int64 values with the ToInt64 method.

summary.para: Returns a single-precision floating point number converted from four bytes at a specified position in a byte array.

returnValue.para: A single-precision floating point number formed by four bytes beginning at startIndex.

content.para: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 4.
The following code example converts elements of T:System.Byte arrays to T:System.Single values with the ToSingle method.

summary.para: Returns a String converted from the elements of a byte array.
Returns a String converted from the elements of a byte array.

returnValue.para: A T:System.String of hexadecimal pairs separated by hyphens, where each pair represents the corresponding element in value; for example, "7F-2C-4A".

content.para: All the elements of value are converted.
The following code example converts T:System.Byte arrays to T:System.String objects with the ToString method.

summary.para: Returns a String converted from the elements of a byte array.
Returns a String converted from the elements of a byte array starting at a specified array position.

returnValue.para: A T:System.String of hexadecimal pairs separated by hyphens, where each pair represents the corresponding element in value; for example, "7F-2C-4A".

content.para: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 1.
The elements from array position startIndex to the end of the array are converted.
The following code example converts the part of a T:System.Byte array starting at the specified startIndex to a T:System.String with the ToString method.

summary.para: Returns a String converted from a specified number of bytes at a specified position in a byte array.

content.para: The number of bytes to convert.

returnValue.para: A T:System.String of hexadecimal pairs separated by hyphens, where each pair represents the corresponding element in value; for example, "7F-2C-4A".

content.para: startIndex or length is less than zero.
startIndex is greater than zero and is greater than or equal to the length of value.
The combination of startIndex and length does not specify a position within value; that is, the startIndex parameter is greater than the length of value minus the length parameter.
The length elements from array position startIndex are converted.
The following code example converts the part of a T:System.Byte array starting at the specified startIndex with the specified length to a T:System.String using the ToString method.

summary.para: Returns a 16-bit unsigned integer converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.

returnValue.para: A 16-bit unsigned integer formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.

content.para: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 2.
The following code example converts elements of T:System.Byte arrays to T:System.UInt16 values with the ToUInt16 method.

summary.para: Returns a 32-bit unsigned integer converted from four bytes at a specified position in a byte array.

returnValue.para: A 32-bit unsigned integer formed by four bytes beginning at startIndex.

content.para: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 4.
The following code example converts elements of T:System.Byte arrays to T:System.UInt32 values with the ToUInt32 method.

summary.para: Returns a 64-bit unsigned integer converted from eight bytes at a specified position in a byte array.

returnValue.para: A 64-bit unsigned integer formed by the eight bytes beginning at startIndex.

content.para: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 8.
The following code example converts elements of T:System.Byte arrays to T:System.UInt64 values with the ToUInt64 method.
